result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sharod Malachi Nunnery

records.addlTxt: Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court, defendant Sharod Malachi Nunnery not in court, in custody.  Daniel T Flaherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means for .  Case in court for status conference. Defense requests plea and sentencing date. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Case in court for scheduling. Discussion held off the record. Defendant has other pending matters, this case to follow. Case adjourned to Br 4.  Status conference scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Sharod Malachi Nunnery in court with Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask; both appear by video.  Defendant Sharod Malachi Nunnery in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 04, Judge Hanrahan. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 04.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Sharod Malachi Nunnery not in court, defendant in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State requests the matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing in the trial court. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Sharod Malachi Nunnery not in court, defendant in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No driving without a valid license and insurance.

Defendant Sharod Malachi Nunnery in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Defendant Sharod Malachi Nunnery in custody.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sharod Malachi Nunnery appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised that due to the lower pending matter, this case has been re-assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
